contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox person | bgcolour = silver | name = Ismael Rodríguez | image = Ismael Rodríguez.jpg | imagesize = 200px | caption = | birth_date = 19 October 1917 | birth_place = [[Mexico City]], [[Mexico]] | death_date = 7 August 2004 | death_place =[[Mexico City]] | birthname = | yearsactive = | othername = | homepage = |}} '''Ismael Rodríguez''' (October 19, 1917 – August 7, 2004) was an acclaimed [[Mexico|Mexican]] [[film director]]. Rodríguez directed many major stars, including [[Pedro Infante]], [[Dolores del Río]], [[María Félix]], and even [[Toshiro Mifune]], the favorite actor of [[Japan]]ese director [[Akira Kurosawa]], as a Mexican [[Amerindian|Indian]] in the film ''[[Ánimas Trujano (film)|Ánimas Trujano]]'' (1961). This film was nominated for an [[Academy Awards|Oscar]] for [[Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film|Best Foreign Language Film]].<ref name="Oscars1962">{{Cite web|url=http://www.oscars.org/awards/academyawards/legacy/ceremony/34th-winners.html |title=The 34th Academy Awards (1962) Nominees and Winners |accessdate=2011-10-29|work=oscars.org}}</ref> Rodríguez's most renowned international film is ''[[Tizoc (film)|Tizoc]]'', in which [[Pedro Infante]]-who starred alongside Maria Felix -received a Golden Globe nomination for best actor. For this role, Infante won the [[Silver Bear for Best Actor]] at the [[7th Berlin International Film Festival]].<ref name="berlinale 1957">{{cite web |url=http://www.berlinale.de/en/archiv/jahresarchive/1957/03_preistr_ger_1957/03_Preistraeger_1957.html |title=Berlinale 1957: Prize Winners |accessdate=2009-12-31 |work=berlinale.de}}</ref> Pedro Infante died in a plane crash. on April 15, 1957, before receiving the award. When Ismael Rodriguez asked Pedro's mother to keep the Silver Bear, she refused to accept it. Instead she told Rodriguez that because He had "made" Pedro Infante, deserved to keep the statue. He humbly did. Rodriguez, not only worked with the best of Mexican and international actors, he made some of the most memorable movies of the time. A brilliant writer/director. ==Filmography== * ''[[Mexicanos, al grito de guerra (film)|Mexicanos, al grito de guerra]]'' * ''[[Nosotros los pobres]]'' * ''[[Dos tipos de Cuidado]]'' * ''[[El niño y el muro]]'' * ''[[The Paper Man (film)|The Paper Man]]'' ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{IMDb name|id=0735879|name=Ismael Rodríguez}} {{Authority control|VIAF=98155745}} <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]] --> {{Persondata |NAME= Rodríguez, Ismael |ALTERNATIVE NAMES= |SHORT DESCRIPTION=[[Film director]] |DATE OF BIRTH= 19 October 1917 |PLACE OF BIRTH= [[Mexico City]], [[Mexico]] |DATE OF DEATH= 7 August 2004 |PLACE OF DEATH=[[Mexico City]] }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Rodriguez, Ismael}} [[Category:1917 births]] [[Category:2004 deaths]] [[Category:Mexican film directors]] [[Category:Golden Ariel Award winners]] [[Category:People from Mexico City]] [[Category:Deaths from respiratory failure]] {{Mexico-film-director-stub}}
